title: Getting Started with peruopen
text: peruopen package provides comprehensive interface Peru’s CKAN data portal (datosabiertos.gob.pe), enabling search, discover, download open government datasets directly R. peruopen, can access 3,954 datasets 10,000+ resources 283+ government organizations Peru.

title: Getting Started with peruopen
text: Install package GitHub:
code: # Install from GitHub devtools::install_github("horaciochacon/peruopen") library(peruopen)

SINADEF: Certificado Defunciones Organization: Ministerio de Salud - MINSA Resources: 2 (data, xlsx) Size: 0.0 MB Last updated: [Unknown] Created: [Unknown] Notes: Contiene los datos del fallecido, genera el certificado de defunción y el informe estadístico; incluye las defunciones fetales, las defunciones generales y las diagnósticos y antecedentes de enfermedad de causas de defunción, los datos son preliminares la fecha Vacunación contra COVID - 19 [Ministerio de Salud - MINSA] Organization: Ministerio de Salud - MINSA Resources: 3 (data, xls, xlsx) Size: 0.0 MB Last updated: [Unknown] Created: [Unknown] Notes: Los datos publicados corresponden las vacunas reportadas contra COVID-19 nivel nominal. Codigos equivalentes de UBIGEO del Peru Organization: Ministerio de Salud - MINSA Resources: 2 (data, xlsx) Size: 0.0 MB Last updated: 2021-08-09 Created: [Unknown] Notes: Contiene las equivalencias de los códigos de UBIGEO del Perú, codificados por RENIEC y el INEI. text: Peru’s open data portal includes datasets : MINSA - Ministry Health (epidemiological data, health statistics) MEF - Ministry Economy (budget execution, economic indicators) MINEDU - Ministry Education (educational statistics) INEI - National Statistics Institute (census, demographic data) Regional Governments - Local statistics programs 283+ organizations total portal contains approximately 1.7 TB data across resources.

what: peruopen - Access Peru's Open Data Portal
title: peruopen - Access Peru's Open Data Portal
text: peruopen provides comprehensive R interface Peru’s CKAN data portal (datosabiertos.gob.pe), enabling users search, discover, download open government datasets directly R.

title: peruopen - Access Peru's Open Data Portal
text: 🔍 Smart Search: Search across 3,954+ datasets flexible filtering organization, format, content 📊 Data Catalog: Browse complete catalog metadata datasets 10,000+ resources ⚡ Fast Downloads: Intelligent resource selection caching efficient data access 🎨 Beautiful Output: Colored console output easy data exploration 🔄 Robust API: Built-retry logic error handling reliable data access 📖 Rich Metadata: Access complete dataset information including organizations, formats, descriptions

title: peruopen - Access Peru's Open Data Portal
text: can install development version peruopen GitHub :
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("horaciochacon/peruopen")

title: peruopen - Access Peru's Open Data Portal
code: library(peruopen)  # Get the complete data catalog (3,954 datasets, 10,000+ resources) catalog <- po_catalog()  # Search for COVID-related data covid_data <- po_search("covid") covid_data  # Explore data by topic health_data <- po_explore("salud") health_data  # Download a specific dataset malaria_data <- po_get("malaria-2024")  # Find all CSV files about dengue dengue_csv <- po_search("dengue", formats = "CSV")

title: peruopen - Access Peru's Open Data Portal
code: # Search across all fields climate_data <- po_search("cambio climático")  # Filter by organization minsa_data <- po_search(organizations = "MINSA")  # Find specific file formats excel_files <- po_search(formats = c("XLSX", "XLS"))  # Search only in tags health_tags <- po_search("salud", search_tags_only = TRUE)

title: peruopen - Access Peru's Open Data Portal
code: # Explore all available data overview <- po_explore()  # Focus on specific topic education <- po_explore("educación")  # See what organizations publish data overview$by_organization

title: peruopen - Access Peru's Open Data Portal
code: # Download best available resource from dataset data <- po_get("covid-vaccinations")  # Get specific format csv_data <- po_get("dataset-name", format = "CSV")  # Download multiple resources resources <- catalog$resources %>%    filter(format == "CSV", size_mb < 50) all_data <- po_get(resources)  # Save files locally po_get("dataset-name", save_to = "data/peru/")

title: peruopen - Access Peru's Open Data Portal
text: Peru open data portal contains: 3,954 datasets 283+ government organizations 10,000+ resources multiple formats (CSV, Excel, JSON, PDF, etc.) ~1.7 TB total data across resources Regular updates ministries, regional governments, agencies

title: peruopen - Access Peru's Open Data Portal

what: Get searchable catalog of Peru open data with smart loading — po_catalog
title: Get searchable catalog of Peru open data with smart loading — po_catalog
text: Downloads returns catalog datasets resources Peru's open data portal. Uses intelligent chunked loading handle API limitations. Can get partial complete catalogs based target size.

title: Get searchable catalog of Peru open data with smart loading — po_catalog
code: po_catalog(   refresh = FALSE,   verbose = TRUE,   target_size = NULL,   extend_existing = FALSE )

title: Get searchable catalog of Peru open data with smart loading — po_catalog
text: refresh Logical. Force refresh cached catalog (default FALSE) verbose Logical. Show progress messages (default TRUE) target_size Integer. Number datasets fetch (default NULL = try 3954) extend_existing Logical. Add data existing catalog (default FALSE)

title: Get searchable catalog of Peru open data with smart loading — po_catalog
text: list containing: datasets Tibble datasets summary information resources Tibble resources linked parent datasets summary List catalog statistics metadata

title: Get searchable catalog of Peru open data with smart loading — po_catalog
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Get a working subset (1000-1500 datasets) catalog <- po_catalog(target_size = 1500)  # Get more coverage progressively catalog <- po_catalog(target_size = 2500)  # Try to get everything (may timeout) catalog <- po_catalog()  # Extend existing catalog with more data more_catalog <- po_catalog(target_size = 3000, extend_existing = TRUE)  # Find all CSV files under 50MB csv_files <- catalog$resources %>%   filter(format == "CSV", size_mb < 50)  # Find datasets by organization minsa_data <- catalog$datasets %>%   filter(grepl("MINSA", organization)) } # }

what: Smart getter for Peru open data — po_get
title: Smart getter for Peru open data — po_get
text: Intelligently fetches data metadata based identifier(s) provided. Works dataset names, dataset IDs, resource IDs, tibbles po_catalog/po_search.

title: Smart getter for Peru open data — po_get
code: po_get(   identifier,   what = c("data", "info", "all"),   format = NULL,   clean_names = TRUE,   save_to = NULL,   encoding = c("UTF-8", "Latin1", "Windows-1252", "ISO-8859-1", "auto"),   use_cache = TRUE,   verbose = TRUE )

title: Smart getter for Peru open data — po_get
text: identifier Dataset name, dataset ID, resource ID(s), tibble resources get: "data" (default), "info", "" format Preferred format multiple available (e.g., "CSV", "XLSX") clean_names Logical. Clean column names R compatibility (default TRUE) save_to Directory path save downloaded files (default NULL = saving) encoding Character encoding: "UTF-8" (default), "Latin1", "Windows-1252", "ISO-8859-1", "auto" use_cache Logical. Use cached files available (default TRUE) verbose Logical. Show download progress (default TRUE)

title: Smart getter for Peru open data — po_get

title: Smart getter for Peru open data — po_get
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Get data using dataset name malaria <- po_get("malaria-2024")  # Get metadata only info <- po_get("malaria-2024", what = "info")  # Get specific resource by ID data <- po_get("abc-123-resource-id")  # Get multiple resources resources <- po_get(c("resource-id-1", "resource-id-2"))  # Get resources from catalog/search results catalog <- po_catalog() csv_resources <- catalog$resources %>% filter(format == "CSV") all_csv_data <- po_get(csv_resources)  # Save files locally with original names data <- po_get("dataset-name", save_to = "data/peru/")  # Force specific encoding for Spanish characters data <- po_get("resource-id", encoding = "Windows-1252") data <- po_get("resource-id", encoding = "ISO-8859-1")  # Cache control examples data <- po_get("resource-id")  # Uses cache if available data <- po_get("resource-id", use_cache = FALSE)  # Force fresh download } # }
